distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for xorg-x11-server is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
X.Org is an open-source implementation of the X Window System. It provides the basic low-level functionality that full-fledged graphical user interfaces are designed upon.

Security Fix(es):

* xorg-x11-server: X.Org Server Overlay Window Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability (CVE-2023-1393)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: xorg-x11-server security and bug fix update

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in X.Org Server. This flaw occurs if a client explicitly destroys the compositor overlay window (aka COW), where Xserver leaves a dangling pointer to that window in the CompScreen structure, which will later trigger a use-after-free issue. The Overlay Window use-after-free issue can lead to a local privilege escalation vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: xorg-x11-server: X.Org Server Overlay Window Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Xorg server does not run with root privileges in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9. Therefore, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and 9 have been rated Moderate severity.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: xorg-x11-server: X.Org Server Overlay Window Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
